channel.title: PvP Planet ~ Removed Anti Leech
channel.description:
I set myself a challange to remove the Anti Leech on Jinrake's PvP Planet V2.5.
I have almost removed all of the Anti-leach that Jinrake has made on his V2.5, and have come to one final hurdle, and that is that it said the server is already being used, even though I'm not hosting.
I want to finish my challenge but need help on this one last part. If you know the answer, then please tell me :D
It will be greatly appreciated.

item.title: PvP Planet ~ Removed Anti Leech
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

The main bit that I’m confused about is why this has to be in it…

java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept(); s.setTcpNoDelay(true); String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName(); if ( /* * connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") || * connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1") */true) { if (connectingHost.contains("*")) { misc.println("Checking Server Status..."); s.close(); misc.println("Made by Jinrake"); } else { misc.println("Made by Jinrake");[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 07, 2009, 05:56:00 pm[/size][hr]No use changing port…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 07, 2009, 06:13:03 pm[/size][hr]SORTED! Thanks for your help, now I can leach it! Jokes

Here is what the problem was…

//killServer(); //I feel sorry for you noobs } public int limitcount(String host) { int numz = 0; for (String h : connections) { if (host.equals(h)) { numz++; } return numz; } return numz; } }
To…

			}
		} catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
			if (!shutdownClientHandler) {
				misc.println("Server is already in use.");
			} else {
				misc.println("ClientHandler was shut down.");
			}
		}
	}
	public int limitcount(String host) {
		int numz = 0;
		for (String h : connections) {
			if (host.equals(h)) {
				numz++;
			}
		return numz;
		}
		return numz;
		}
}

It was the killserver bit

item.title: PvP Planet ~ Removed Anti Leech
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

Changed the port to 5555 that’s what I want it to be.

Server.java holds the following that I am curious about, and have played about with but no success.

[code] public int getConnections(String host) {
int count = 0;
for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
if ((p != null) && !p.disconnected
&& p.connectedFrom.equalsIgnoreCase(host)) {
count++;
}
}
return count;
}

public void killServer() {
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = true;
		if (clientListener != null)
			clientListener.close();
		clientListener = null;
	} catch (java.lang.Exception __ex) {
		__ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}

public void run() {
	// setup the listener
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = false;
		clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort + 6666, 1,
				null);
		misc.println("PVP Planet online by Jinrake");
		while (true) {
			try {
				java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();
				s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
				String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
				if ( /*
				 * connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") ||
				 * connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1")
				 */true) {
					if (connectingHost.contains("*")) {
						misc.println("Checking Server Status...");
						s.close();
		misc.println("Made by Jinrake");
					} else {
		misc.println("Made by Jinrake");
						connections.add(connectingHost);
						if (limitcount(connectingHost) > 2) {
							s.close();
						}
						if (checkHost(connectingHost)) {
							//misc.println("Connection from "
									//+ connectingHost + ":" + s.getPort());
					s.close();
		misc.println("Made by Jinrake");
						} else {
							//misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected "
									//+ connectingHost + ":" + s.getPort());
							s.close();
		misc.println("Made by Jinrake");
						}
					}
				} else {
					misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected "
							+ connectingHost + ":" + s.getPort());
					s.close();
				}
				if ((delayUpdate > 0)
						&& (System.currentTimeMillis() > delayUpdate)) {
					delay = 50;
					delayUpdate = 0;
				}
				Thread.sleep(100);
			} catch (Exception e) {
				logError(e.getMessage());
			}
		}
	} catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
		if (!shutdownClientHandler) {
			misc.println("Server is already in use.");
		} else {
			misc.println("ClientHandler was shut down.");
		}
	}

//killServer(); //I feel sorry for you noobs
}
public int limitcount(String host) {
int numz = 0;
for (String h : connections) {
if (host.equals(h)) {
numz++;
}
return numz;
}
return numz;
}
}
[/code]
I also don’t get what CJ is on about lol, don’t see how it will help matters.

Read full topic
